mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Walton to Benjamin Lincoln, 1779 December 21
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Walton, George, 1749 or 1750-1804
mdRecord.dcterms:description: George Walton, signer of the Declaration of Independence, writes to Major General Benjamin Lincoln seeking his help regarding sums for the military being misapplied by citizens [Georgia] and hung up in the Department of the Army resulting in shortages for the troops in the Georgia militias. Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, with integral address panel.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Wayne Rickert Collection of Founders' Autographs
